alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lincoln (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 9:09AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Columbia, southeastern Lincoln, western Newberry, Edgefield, western Saluda and eastern McCormick Counties through 1000 AM EST... At 909 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Troy to near J. Strom Thurmond Dam. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Edgefield, Saluda, McCormick, Johnston, Troy, Saluda County Airport, Edgefield County Airport, Mccormick County Airport, Hamilton Branch State Park, Lake Greenwood, Trenton, Bradley, Parksville, Plum Branch, Strom Thurmond High School, Good Hope, Modoc, Scott`s Landing, Northside Fire Station Main and Belfast Wildlife Management Area. This includes Interstate 26 near mile marker 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EST for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
